{{Set index}}

''Minecraft'' includes various game customization, supported by [[Mojang Studios]] and the community:

*{{EnvLink|id=addon|Add-on}} &ndash; a {{w|video game modding|modding}} API for game customization in versions of {{BE}}, officially supported by [[Mojang Studios]]. Composed of [[behavior pack]]s and resource packs (see below).
*{{EnvLink|id=other-portal|Mod}} &ndash; a piece of unofficial code that is injected into the game for the purpose of modifying its behavior. This kind of modification is more common and prevalent {{in|JE}}.
*[[File:Wrench.png|16px|link=|class=pixel-image]] [[Data pack]] &ndash; a system which provides a method of customizing data-driven features such as [[recipe]]s, [[loot table]]s, and [[world generation]] {{in|JE}} without any code modification.
*{{ItemLink|id=brush|Resource pack}} &ndash; a system which provides a way for players to customize the following without any code modification: textures, [[model]]s, [[music]], [[sound]]s, and [[language]]s, and fonts; and texts such as the [[End Poem]], [[splash]]es, [[Credit sequence|credits]].
**{{EnvLink|Texture pack}} &ndash; the predecessor of resource packs that changes in-game textures of blocks, items, mobs, and GUIs.
**{{ItemLink|id=compass|Texture atlas}} &ndash; an arrangement of game sprites on a single image file, used in early versions of the game to store and access associated sprites more efficiently than with individual files.
*{{EnvLink|id=multiplayer|Skin}} &ndash; textures that are placed onto the [[player]] character model.
**{{PersonaLink|id=Pancape|Capes}} &ndash; commemorative items that are worn on the back of the player character.
**{{PersonaLink|Character Creator}} &ndash; a feature in ''Bedrock Edition'' that lets players customize their character model with free and paid-for cosmetic items or apparels.
